articles.content:
State Citations Conferred upon Participants in "Arirang" 
    Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- The Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly promulgated a decree on awarding state citations to the participants in the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang", Kim Il Sung Prize winner.
 The decree dated Nov. 6 said that the Presidium of the DPRK SPA awards Kim Il Sung Youth Honour Prize, Kim Il Sung Children Honour Prize, DPRK honorary titles, orders and medals to the participants in the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang" for having re-depicted the Kim Il Sung Prize laureate grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang" as a great success of the Juche-oriented culture and arts and a grand monumental masterpiece in a new century, thereby brilliantly decorating the 60th anniversaries of the foundation of the Workers' Party of Korea and Korea's liberation as a grand festival of victors and greatly contributing to fully demonstrating the might of the single-minded unity of Songun Korea united close around the Party and the leader to the whole world and presenting the great flower garden of Juche-oriented arts.    
 According to the decree, a total of 52,337 persons received state citations. Among them 58 were awarded Kim Il Sung Youth Honour Prize, five persons Kim Il Sung Children Honour Prize, three persons the title of People's Artist, three persons the title of People's Sportsman, seven the title of Merited Artist, two persons the title of Merited Sportsman, five persons the title of Merited Actor, 54 persons the Order of the National Flag First Class, 177 persons the Order of Labour, 508 persons the Order of the National Flag Second Class, 22 persons the Order of Honour of  Soldier First Class, 1177 persons the Order of the National Flag Third Class, 23 persons the Order of Honor of Soldier Second Class, 2,622 persons Distinguished Service Medal and 47,671 persons Medal of Merit.

articles.content:
Greetings to Angolan President
    Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Jose Eduardo Dos Santos, president of Angola, on Nov. 9 on the occasion of the 30th anniversary of its independence.
 The message said that the Korean people sincerely rejoice over the great successes made by the Angolan people in the work for peace and stability and socio-economic progress of the country over the last three decades since it attained national independence through a hard-fought armed struggle under the leadership of the Popular Liberation Movement of Angola.    
 The close ties of friendship, cooperation and solidarity forged between the two peoples since the period of the national liberation struggle of the Angolan people have grown stronger in every field since the opening of the diplomatic relations between the two countries on Nov. 16, 1975. 
 In the belief that the good bilateral ties of friendship and cooperation would continue to develop in the future, the message wished the president and the people of Angola greater success in their work for consolidating the peace of the country and achieving the progress and prosperity of the country.
